metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9400 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: The CClient::ProcessServerPacket method in engine/client/client.cpp in Teeworlds before 0.6.4 allows remote servers to write to arbitrary physical memory locations and possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors involving snap handling.

criterions.comment: teeworlds: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
